body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:
I have an running ipv6-only cluster using IPVS.  The pod to pod and pod to service communication is working fine. But I am not able to access the pod externally using nodeport. 

 sudo kubectl get svc
NAME            TYPE        CLUSTER-IP   EXTERNAL-IP   PORT(S)                         AGE
elasticsearch   NodePort    fd20::91c1   <none>        9200:32140/TCP,9300:30866/TCP   15s
kubernetes      ClusterIP   fd20::1      <none>        443/TCP                         4m33s

 sudo kubectl get pods -o wide
NAME                             READY   STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE   IP           NODE    NOMINATED NODE   READINESS GATES
elasticsearch-669dc996cd-bsrcg   1/1     Running   0          19m   fd20::7043   demo1   <none>           <none>

**What you expected to happen:**

I expected to have an ipvs rule related to node port. But no entry in IPVS. 

IP Virtual Server version 1.2.1 (size=4096)
Prot LocalAddress:Port Scheduler Flags
  -> RemoteAddress:Port           Forward Weight ActiveConn InActConn
TCP  [fd20::1]:443 rr
  -> [2001:db8:0:f101::2]:6443    Masq    1      5          0
TCP  [fd20::a]:53 rr
  -> [fd20::7041]:53              Masq    1      0          0
  -> [fd20::7042]:53              Masq    1      0          0
TCP  [fd20::a]:9153 rr
  -> [fd20::7041]:9153            Masq    1      0          0
  -> [fd20::7042]:9153            Masq    1      0          0
TCP  [fd20::91c1]:9200 rr
  -> [fd20::7043]:9200            Masq    1      0          0
TCP  [fd20::91c1]:9300 rr
  -> [fd20::7043]:9300            Masq    1      0          0
UDP  [fd20::a]:53 rr
  -> [fd20::7041]:53              Masq    1      0          0
  -> [fd20::7042]:53              Masq    1      0          0

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): Kubernetes v1.17.2
- Network Plugin/Version : Calico Version  -  v 3.10.2
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`):  Ubuntu 16.04.5 LTS
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux demo1 4.4.0-131-generic #157-Ubuntu  x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Tools used:  kubeadm 

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible):**
1. install latest kubernetes (v.1.17.2) version 
2. create a pod as type nodeport.

**Anything else we need to know?**:
I could see lots of error messages in kube-proxy 

E0128 08:08:55.468535       1 proxier.go:1976] Failed to add destination: [fd20::7043]:9200, error: file exists
E0128 08:08:55.468740       1 graceful_termination.go:144] Delete rs "[fd20::91c1]:9200/TCP/253.32.0.0:9200" err: Delete destination "253.32.0.0:9200" err: no such file or directory
E0128 08:08:55.468785       1 proxier.go:2006] Failed to delete destination: [fd20::91c1]:9200/TCP/253.32.0.0:9200, error: no such file or directory
E0128 08:08:55.469064       1 proxier.go:1976] Failed to add destination: [fd20::7043]:9300, error: file exists
E0128 08:08:55.469177       1 graceful_termination.go:144] Delete rs "[fd20::91c1]:9300/TCP/253.32.0.0:9300" err: Delete destination "253.32.0.0:9300" err: no such file or directory
E0128 08:08:55.469230       1 proxier.go:2006] Failed to delete destination: [fd20::91c1]:9300/TCP/253.32.0.0:9300, error: no such file or directory
E0128 08:08:55.469531       1 proxier.go:1976] Failed to add destination: [fd20::7041]:53, error: file exists
E0128 08:08:55.469600       1 proxier.go:1976] Failed to add destination: [fd20::7042]:53, error: file exists
E0128 08:08:55.469713       1 graceful_termination.go:144] Delete rs "[fd20::a]:53/TCP/253.32.0.0:53" err: Delete destination "253.32.0.0:53" err: no such file or directory
E0128 08:08:55.469781       1 proxier.go:2006] Failed to delete destination: [fd20::a]:53/TCP/253.32.0.0:53, error: no such file or directory.

title: Nodeport issues with ipv6-only Cluster
